newsitem.title: USA: Peoplesoft to acquire Co. in stock swap.
newsitem.headline: Peoplesoft to acquire Co. in stock swap.

text.p: PeopleSoft Inc said Wednesday it has agreed to acquire Red Pepper Software, a maker of manufacturing software based in San Mateo, Calif., for 2.975 million of its shares.
PeopleSoft, a developer of client/server software for business, saw its shares close off 1/2 at 75-3/4.
The deal will be accounted for as a pooling of interests and is expected to close by the end of 1996.
"Red Pepper has the best (manufacturing) planning and optimization technology on the market," Dave Duffield, chief executive of PeopleSoft, said in a statement.

In June 1995, PeopleSoft entered into a technology licensing and distribution agreement with Red Pepper, and earlier this year PeopleSoft launched a new line of software that embed Red Pepper's ResponseAgent technology.
The technology enables real-time planning and optimization of manufacturing operations, integrated supply chains, and customer orders, PeopleSoft said.
PeopleSoft will also benefit from the addition of significant Red Pepper's expertise in the areas of manufacturing and supply chain management.

"After working together for more than a year, we know both companies share a common vision for the future of enterprise applications, and have similar corporate cultures and company values," Duffield said in a statement. "This is a great company with great people."
